alert.note: Alert for Delaware Beaches; Inland Sussex (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 12:43PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Sussex County through 130 PM EDT... At 1243 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Cape Henlopen State Park to near Georgetown to near Sycamore to Delmar. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Millsboro, Laurel, Lewes, Milton, Selbyville, Delmar, Dagsboro, Millville, Henlopen Acres, Gumboro, Cape Henlopen State Park, Sycamore, Long Neck, Ocean View, Frankford, South Bethany and Dewey Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Occasional cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
